page.title: 02THE HOME FARM 1 (Arable)
page.content: Mr. Clive Hill, the farm manager and another man work full-time on the farm putting in ten hours a day on average, except at harvesting time when the hours are invariably much longer. A student helps for 3-4 months at harvest time; he works from 8 am to 5 pm for six days a week and is paid extra for week-ends. Out of a total of 475 acres of land, 420 acres are used for growing crops: 80 acres for oil seed rape, 56 acres for winter beans, 64 acres for field beans, 64 acres for tipper barley, 13 acres for spring barley, 120 acres for winter wheat and 70 acres for fodder wheat.
